sentences.sContent: Over the years he's demonstrated a certain prescience in foreign affairs.
sentences.sContent_eng: Over the years he's demonstrated a certain prescience in foreign affairs.
sentences.sCn: 这些年来，他已经在外交事务方面表现出一定的预见性。 。

sentences.sContent: Stay one step ahead of change: One of the factors that fueled Welch's success was his prescience.
sentences.sContent_eng: Stay one step ahead of change: One of the factors that fueled Welch's success was his prescience.
sentences.sCn: 提前做好变革的准备： 韦尔奇的预见能力是助他成功的一项要素。

sentences.sContent: Darwin's intellect, humility ("It is always advisable to perceive clearly our ignorance") and prescience astonish more as scientists clarify, in detail he never imagined, how much he got right.
sentences.sContent_eng: Darwin's intellect, humility ("It is always advisable to perceive clearly our ignorance") and prescience astonish more as scientists clarify, in detail he never imagined, how much he got right.
sentences.sCn: 在科学家们弄清楚他从未在细节上作过设想，他对了多少的时候，达尔文的睿智，谦逊（这对我们觉醒自己的无知很可取）和预见使我们更惊讶。

remMethod.val: 来自prescien (t) (有先见之明的) + ce → 预知； 先见
